ollama.desc: Go to "ollama.com/download" and click on the download that's meant for your operating system.
Locate the exe file and click on it.
If you're on windows, a popup like this should appear. Go through the installation process.
Once the install is done, locate the actual app and click it.
When Ollama is running you should see a small icon in your taskbar. No GUI or popup will showup, this is what indicates that you have ollama running.
Go to "ollama.com/library". This is where you can browse through all the ai models available with ollama.
In this example we're going to be downloading llama3.1 but you can download any model you want.
You'll be taken to this page where you can view the details about the model.
This is the name of the model that you need to type in later.

You can also specifiy which "parameter" model you want to use. To keep things simple, generally the bigger the parameter, the better the quality of the responses will be. But this also means you'd need better hardware.
You can view even more details about a model by clicking on this section
This will tell you the context window of a model. Which is basically how much text the ai will remember in your whole history of conversation.
Now go back and copy the underlined name here.
Now in the game go to the settings.
Finally, click on download model and paste in the model name you copied earlier.
